items.content:
Silver Supply Reality Check:

If you're holding - you own an asset in genuine supply deficit. 

If you're buying - availability matters more than price optimization right now. 

If you're waiting for pullbacks - the physical might not be there when you decide to buy.

Paper

China’s Shuibei silver market is on fire:

1kg bars selling at $60.28/oz

Over 10kg? 1-month delivery wait

Pre-sold bars at $52.34/oz, paid in full, buyers waiting, no guarantees (some merchants already vanished)

Direct refinery pickup? $56.70/oz + VAT + fees

Physical

items.content:
India’s largest precious metals refinery has run out of Silver for the first time in history 

Demand from Indian buyers ahead of Diwali has gone vertical, shelves empty, supply drained.

Silver isn’t just scarce. It’s disappearing.

items.content:
Silver supply chain breaking: 
Heraeus (major global refinery) no longer committing to delivery dates.

Existing orders: 1-2 month estimated delivery (mid-Nov to early Dec)
New orders: Queue position only, no delivery commitment

Simply put: they'll produce bars when they can
